messages.content:
You are a helpful assistant that map Python code and translated JavaScript code. 
For user requests, you output the mapping directly in consistent formats without explanations.
You should not make any changes to the provided code pair when you output the mapping. 
You can only add annotations at the end of the line for each statement.
You should not skip statements when you output the mapping.

### Python

```python
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    i = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    chars = set()   # --- py stmt 5
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 6
        if c == ' ':   # --- py stmt 7
            continue   # --- py stmt 8
        elif c == '*':   # --- py stmt 9
            break   # --- py stmt 10
        while c in chars:   # --- py stmt 11
            chars.remove(s[i])   # --- py stmt 12
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 13
        chars.add(c)   # --- py stmt 14
        ans = max(ans, j - i + 1)   # --- py stmt 15
        ans = max(   # --- py stmt 16
          ans, i - j + 1
        )
    ans, i = ans * 2, i + 1   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans   # --- py stmt 18
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
var f_gold = function(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var i = 0, ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 3, py stmt 4
    var chars = new Set();   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var j = 0; j < s.length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        if (s[j] === ' ') continue;   // --- py stmt 7, py stmt 8
        else if (c === '*') {   // --- py stmt 9
            break;   // --- py stmt 10
        }
        while (chars.has(s[j])) {   // --- py stmt 11
            chars.delete(s[i]);   // --- py stmt 12
            i++;   // --- py stmt 13
        }
        chars.add(s[j]);   // --- py stmt 14
        ans = Math.max(ans, j - i + 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        ans = Math.max(ans, i - j + 1);   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    ans = ans * 2;   // --- py stmt 17
    i = i + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 18
}
```

message.content:
### Python

```python
### minWindow 
import math   # --- py stmt 1
from math import inf   # --- py stmt 2
from collections import Counter   # --- py stmt 3
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 4
def f_gold(s: str, t: str) -> str:   # --- py stmt 5
    ans = ''   # --- py stmt 6
    m, n = len(s), len(t)   # --- py stmt 7
    if m < n:   # --- py stmt 8
        return ans   # --- py stmt 9
    need = Counter(t)   # --- py stmt 10
    window = Counter()   # --- py stmt 11
    i, cnt, mi = 0, 0, float('inf')   # --- py stmt 12
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 13
        window[c] += 1   # --- py stmt 14
        if need[c] >= window[c]:   # --- py stmt 15
            cnt += 1   # --- py stmt 16
        while cnt == n:   # --- py stmt 17
            if j - i + 1 < mi:   # --- py stmt 18
                mi = j - i + 1   # --- py stmt 19
                ans = s[i : j + 1]   # --- py stmt 20
            c = s[i]   # --- py stmt 21
            if need[c] >= window[c]:   # --- py stmt 22
                cnt -= 1   # --- py stmt 23
            window[c] -= 1   # --- py stmt 24
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 25
    return ans   # --- py stmt 26
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
function f_gold(s, t) {   // --- py stmt 5
    var ans = '';   // --- py stmt 6
    var m = s.length;   // --- py stmt 7
    var n = t.length;   // --- py stmt 7
    if (m < n) {   // --- py stmt 8
        return ans;   // --- py stmt 9
    }
    var need = new Map();   // --- py stmt 10
    for (var _c of t) need.set(_c, 1 + (need.has(_c) ? need.get(_c) : 0));   // --- py stmt 10
    var window = new Map();   // --- py stmt 11
    var i = 0, cnt = 0, mi = Number.MAX_VALUE;   // --- py stmt 12
    for (var j = 0; j < m; j++) {   // --- py stmt 13
        var c = s.charAt(j);   // --- py stmt 14
        if (window.has(c)) {   // --- py stmt 15
            window.set(c, window.get(c) + 1);   // --- py stmt 14
        }
        else {
            window.set(c, 1);   // --- py stmt 14
        }
        if (need.has(c) && need.get(c) >= window.get(c)) {   // --- py stmt 15
            cnt++;   // --- py stmt 16
        }
        while (cnt == n) {   // --- py stmt 17
            if (j - i + 1 < mi) {   // --- py stmt 18
                mi = j - i + 1;   // --- py stmt 19
                ans = s.substring(i, j + 1);   // --- py stmt 20
            }
            c = s.charAt(i);   // --- py stmt 21
            if (need.has(c) && need.get(c) >= window.get(c)) {   // --- py stmt 22
                cnt--;   // --- py stmt 23
            }
            window.set(c, window.get(c) - 1);   // --- py stmt 24
            i++;   // --- py stmt 25
        }
    }
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 26
}
```
